qas.question: When did Espanyol  offer a counter-petition against autonomy?
Which civil war group did some Espanyol supporters join?
What event is more relevant to Espanyol supporters than to Barcelona fans?
From what language did Espanyol translate their name?
How has the rivalry between Espanyol and Barcelona  changed?

context: In <a0_0>1918<a0_0/> Espanyol started a counter-petition against autonomy, which at that time had become a pertinent issue. Later on, an Espanyol supporter group would join the <a1_0>Falangists<a1_0/> in the Spanish Civil War, siding with the fascists. Despite these differences in ideology, the <a2_0>derbi<a2_0/> has always been more relevant to Espanyol supporters than Barcelona ones due to the difference in objectives. In recent years the rivalry has become <a4_0>less political<a4_0/>, as Espanyol translated its official name and anthem from <a3_0>Spanish<a3_0/> to Catalan.
